data.text: @shreyaresh Sure! Not gunna bc it’s fine to have different opinions and u do u 👍🏼 your points are valid.

@ohbaudelaire I’d totally understand anger ab policy change if people at MIT did end up in the hospital for Omicron, but like, they didn’t :/ i’d imagine that it would be hard to dodge S3 if you were in such a situation. that’s my take
@ohbaudelaire i’m speaking from my POV and my experience from living in Baker though, feel free to disagree

@ohbaudelaire i can only hope that the classes continue to offer a virtual version for us in isolation, bc covid is still clearly here. within my living group (notorious for not wearing masks) everyone followed honor code whenever testing positive and voluntarily tested when they had symptoms

@ohbaudelaire i finally caught covid 03/15 after someone in my friend group caught it. at some point we have to accept that COVID will run its course through the population eventually and it’s minor enough that no one will be compromised. even when I had covid it was mainly honor code (2/3)

@ohbaudelaire idk, I kinda disagree with this. they don’t take such policy decisions lightly—we’re often one of the last schools in the nation to relax restrictions. they decided this after zero of the thousands of cases in the community ended up in a hospital (1/2)
@ohbaudelaire @katiedimartin Getting harder to tell on this site …
@oski_the_bear @ohbaudelaire also when you reply to something someone has retweeted it tags both the original poster and the retweeter
